data.name: Ampharos
data.flavorText: The tip of its tail shines brightly. In the olden days, people sent signals using the tail's light.

abilities.name: Jamming
abilities.text: After your opponent plays a Supporter card from his or her hand, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon. You can't use more than 1 Jamming Poké-Body each turn.

attacks.name: Cluster Bolt
attacks.text: You may discard all Lightning Energy attached to Ampharos. If you do, this attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any Energy cards attached to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Gallade
data.flavorText: A master of courtesy and swordsmanship, it fights using extending swords on it elbows.

attacks.name: Sonic Blade
attacks.text: Put damage counters on the Defending Pokémon until it is 50 HP away from being Knocked Out. If you do, your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psychic Cut
attacks.text: You may choose as many of your face-down Prize cards as you like and put them face up. If you do, this attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage for each Prize card you chose. (These cards remain face up for the rest of the game.)

data.name: Latias
data.flavorText: Its body is covered with a down that can refract light in such a way that it becomes invisible.

attacks.name: Miraculous Light
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters and all Special Conditions from Latias.

attacks.name: Mist Ball
attacks.text: Discard a Fire and a Water Energy attached to Latias.

data.name: Latios
data.flavorText: A highly intelligent Pokémon. By folding back its wings in flight, it can overtake jet planes.

attacks.name: Energy Draw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to Latios. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Luster Purge
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy attached to Latios.

data.name: Flaaffy
data.flavorText: If its coat becomes fully charged with electricity, its tail lights up. It fire hair that zaps on impact.

attacks.name: Attract Current
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Electromagnetic Kick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Flaaffy does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Mothim
data.flavorText: It loves the honey of flowers and steals honey collected by COMBEE.

attacks.name: Silver Wind
attacks.text: During your next turn, if an attack does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Raging Scales
attacks.text: If Mothim has any damage counters on it, this attack does 30 damage plus 40 more damage.

data.name: Delibird
data.flavorText: It carries food rolled up in its tail. It has the habit of sharing food with people lost in mountains.

attacks.name: Present
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for any 1 card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Kirlia
data.flavorText: It is highly perceptive of its Trainer's feelings. It dances when it is feeling happy.

attacks.name: Psychic Research
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Supporter card and use the effect of that card as the effect of this attack. (The Supporter card remains in your discard pile.)

attacks.name: Telekinesis
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.name: Stantler
data.flavorText: Staring at its antlers creates an odd sensation as if one were being drawn into their centers.

attacks.name: Lead
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Supporter card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Frighten Horn
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon isn't an Evolved Pokémon, that Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Corsola
data.flavorText: Many live in the clean seas of the south. They apparently can't live in polluted waters.

attacks.name: Rally
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 different types of Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Wormadam Sandy Cloak
data.flavorText: When BURMY evolved, it cloak became a part of this Pokémon's body. The cloak is never shed.

abilities.name: Sandy Cloak
abilities.text: Prevent all effects, excluding damage, done to Wormadam Sandy Cloak.

attacks.name: Push Over
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Fighting Energy attached to Wormadam Sandy Cloak.

data.name: Burmy Plant Cloak
data.flavorText: To shelter itself from cold, wintry winds, it covers itself with a cloak made of twigs and leaves.

abilities.name: Wear Cloak
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Burmy Plant Cloak is your Active Pokémon, you may search your discard pile for a basic Grass Energy card and attach it to Burmy Plant Cloak.

attacks.name: Plant Cloak Tackle
attacks.text: If Burmy Plant Cloak has any Grass Energy attached to it, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

data.name: Burmy Sandy Cloak
data.flavorText: To shelter itself from cold, wintry winds, it covers itself with a cloak made of twigs and leaves.

abilities.name: Wear Cloak
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Burmy Sandy Cloak is your Active Pokémon, you may search your discard pile for a basic Fighting Energy card and attach it to Burmy Sandy Cloak.

attacks.name: Sandy Cloak Tackle
attacks.text: If Burmy Sandy Cloak has any Fighting Energy attached to it, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

data.name: Mareep
data.flavorText: Its fluffy coat swells to double when static electricity builds up. Touching it can be shocking.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Ralts
data.flavorText: It uses the horns on its head to sense human emotions. It is said to appear in front of cheerful people.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Sentret
data.flavorText: It has a very nervous nature. It stands up high on its tail so it can scan wide areas.

attacks.name: Grope
attacks.text: Look at the top 2 cards of your deck, choose 1 of them, and put it into your hand. Put the other card on the bottom of your deck.

data.name: Spinda
data.flavorText: No two SPINDA have the same pattern of spots. Its tottering step fouls the aim of foes.

attacks.name: Dish Out
attacks.text: Draw a card from the top and the bottom of your deck.

attacks.name: Synchro Punch
attacks.text: If any basic Energy card attached to Spinda is the same type as any Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage.
